abstract: The Securities and Exchange Commission said that JPMorgan Chase had agreed to pay $75 million and forfeit $647 million in termination fees to settle civil charges that its securities firm had engaged in an “unlawful payment scheme” in Jefferson County.
snippet: The Securities and Exchange Commission said that JPMorgan Chase had agreed to pay $75 million and forfeit $647 million in termination fees to settle civil charges that its securities firm had engaged in an “unlawful payment scheme” in Jefferson Co...
lead_paragraph: The Securities and Exchange Commission said Wednesday that JPMorgan Chase had agreed to pay $75 million in penalties and as well as forfeit $647 million in termination fees to settle civil charges that its securities firm had engaged in an “unlawful payment scheme” to win municipal bond business in Jefferson County, Ala.

headline.main: JPMorgan to Pay $75 Million in Alabama Case
